## Study projects

### Social determinants of mental disorders in Finland - a register-based study (SDMD)

A study project using national register data of the [TRIAD](https://thl.fi/fi/tutkimus-ja-kehittaminen/tutkimukset-ja-hankkeet/epaonnen-kolmikko-mielenterveyden-hairiot-somaattinen-sairastavuus-ja-sosiaalinen-syrjaytyminen-elamankaarella-triad-){target="_blank"} - project, including

-   Interesting papers, including the publication of the year 2021 by EPA
-   Open-source method for pre-processing Finnish healthcare registers
-   My [PhD thesis](https://trepo.tuni.fi/handle/10024/153558)

[Read more](sdmd/index.html)

### Out of Despair

-   [Out of Despair](https://ulosepatoivosta.fi/en/){target="_blank"} focuses on violent, suicidal, and drug-induced deaths and near-miss cases of young people under 30.
-   Multiple data sources, such as linked registers, qualitative interviews, mini-ethnographies, and online discussions will be utilized.
-   The project is funded by The Strategic Research Council (SRC) in the Academy of Finland.

### Finnish Quality of Psychosis Care Register

-   [Finnish Quality of Psychosis Care Register](https://repo.thl.fi/sites/laaturekisterit/psykoosienhoidonrekisteri.html){target="_blank"} is a part of [National quality registers in healthcare and socialservices](https://thl.fi/fi/web/sote-palvelujen-johtaminen/arviointi-ja-seuranta/sote-tietopohja/terveydenhuollon-kansalliset-laaturekisterit/kansallisten-laaturekisterien-raportit) in Finland, hosted by the [Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare (THL)](https://thl.fi/en/web/thlfi-en){target="_blank"}

### The Finnish SUPER study

-   [The Finnish SUPER study](https://www.superfinland.fi/in-english){target="_blank"} on genetic mechanisms of psychotic disorders is a part of the international [Stanley Global Neuropsychiatric Genomics Initiative](https://www.broadinstitute.org/stanley-center-psychiatric-research/stanley-global){target="_blank"}.
-   We have collected a sample of over 10,500 individuals with a history of diagnosed psychotic disorders. Studies of the genetics and fenotypes are on progress.
-   See the [cohort profile](https://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/13/4/e070710){target="_blank"} for details about the prcodeures.
